Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

This class defines the basic interface used by all metric trees implemented by this library.

Developers are encouraged to use this class as the interface to manipulate all trees in their applications (polymorphism).

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Josiel Maimone de Figueiredo (josiel@icmc.usp.br)

Adriano Siqueira Arantes (arantes@icmc.usp.br)

Version:
1.0

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::stMetricTree (  stPageManager *  pageman  )  [inline]
 

Creates a new metric tree using a given page manager. This instance will not claim the ownership of the given page manager. It means that the application must dispose the page manager when it is no loger necessary.

Parameters:
pageman The bage manager to be used by this metric tree.
Deprecated:
This constructor will be deprecated soon.

Definition at line 130 of file stMetricTree.h.

References stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::myMetricEvaluator, stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::myPageManager, and stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::tMetricEvaluator.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::stMetricTree (  stPageManager *  pageman,
EvaluatorType *  metricEval
)  [inline]
 

Creates a new metric tree using a given page manager and metric evaluator. This instance will not claim the ownership of the given page manager and metric evaluator. It means that the application must dispose them when they are no loger necessary. It allows the metric evaluator to be shared by other objects.

Parameters:
pageman The bage manager to be used by this metric tree.
metricEval A shared metric evaluator to be used.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
virtual stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::~stMetricTree (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Disposes this instance and release all associated resources. The page manager will never be disposed by this destructor.

virtual stDistance stMetricTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::GetDistanceLimit (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Returns the limit distance between 2 objects in the tree. That is . In other words, there is no distance greater than this.

Returns:
The maximum distance or -1 if this feature is not supported.
